cyclone.name: PHILIPPE
cyclone.current_location: about 275 mi SSW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-northeast across western Cuba this afternoon, through the Straits of Florida tonight, then over the north-western Bahamas and out into the Atlantic

weather_observation.warning_coast: Isla de la Juventud to Villa Clara Cuba and the north-western Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Cuba, Florida Keys, South Florida (including Miami), north-western Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Gusty squalls with a 10% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds in the Miami area; most winds below gale force
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible but surge ≥3 ft not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: 2-4 inches of rain with localized totals up to 6 inches could cause urban flash flooding around PortMiami
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes possible Saturday afternoon and evening across South Florida
